conclusion: There are four objects and their corresponding shadows on the ground, labeled A, B, C, and D. The shadows are cast towards the front-left relative to the objects.
The light source must be located in the back-right relative to the objects since the shadows are cast towards the front-left.
The light source moves to the back right, likely further into the back-right region, potentially changing its height.
As the light source moves further towards the back and right, the shadows will move further towards the front and left.
The size of a shadow is influenced by the distance between the light source and the object, and the height of the light source above the ground.
Moving the light source to the back right results in the shadows becoming larger if the light source moves closer to the objects or moves lower.
Each shadow (A, B, C, and D) will move towards the front-left direction and become larger in size.
When the light source moves to the back right, the shadows A, B, C, and D will move towards the front left direction and become larger in size.
